page.title: 04Hills Cider Farm Staverton
page.content: Mr.Hill's father Edwin started making cider on a commercial basis in 1934 with the old wooden presses that were there. Whiteways Cider Company bought out all the cider making capacity here except Hills.Three farmworkers now operate hydraulic presses that process about 3000 tons of apples sent in by localfarmers into some 25,000 gallons of cider,designated rough,medium or sweet. Nothing artificial is used except sodium metabisulphide to prevent the juice from spoiling.The pomace from this process is the favourite food of Mr.Hill's dairy herd.The polythene bottles of cider are now sent all over Devon and especially to public houses in this area.Trailers loaded with the cider apples start arriving in October and the cider making continues apace until the end of December.
